revised_title: Inquiry into the Earthy Bases of Vegetable Tissues
tldr: The author investigates the composition of vegetable tissues, specifically the earthy bases of plant tissues, and proposes a new theory. He examines the silica content in bamboo bark and straw epidermis, and suggests that the silica is organized into a series of cells and tubes. He also discusses the observations of other researchers and proposes to replace the term 'bases' with'skeleton' in the description of vegetable tissues.
